text: I love the physical act of cooking I
like everything that you can do in a
kitchen and when you peel a peach
there's a color right beneath the peach
skin that is hidden except for that very
moment it's like they're all these
little secret moments in the kitchen and
if you don't pay attention to that
you're missing so much in life I can
tell a lot about people by what they eat
I can tell even more about them by how
they cook this kitchen says a lot about
Graham the cook who is embracing
everybody and saying come into the
kitchen be with me while I'm cooking
let's do this together the apartment I
grew up in was a small apartment in
Greenwich Village kitchen was kind of
hidden away with a door that was always
closed and that's where I sort of first
learned to cook so I think I probably
get more pleasure from how good my
kitchen is then most people would
when people come to my house they expect
a really great meal so I was determined
that I was going to have a kitchen that
was the center of the house and I
designed this kitchen exactly for my
body and I wanted the whole kitchen to
sort of work so I would never have to
leave this little u one of the great
joys of having an open house like this
is the aroma is the perfume of the
kitchen it goes everywhere it fills up
the entire house it's a complete joy
only matters to me what I have in the
kitchen with it what surrounds me this
is not the world's most efficient juicer
but the physical act of using it is
calming and quiet and a pleasure I do
cook for my family every day and being a
home cook means that you're constantly
learning every time you do something
you're learning a better way to do it
food is much more important than just
eating food is what connects us to
everyday life and the whole architecture
of my kitchen is about creating that
community
Oh
Oh
